summary: This document is a confidential psychiatric observation log detailing the condition and complaints of a detainee (Jeffrey Epstein) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July 2019. It records his physical symptoms (marks on neck, numbness), psychological distress (anxiety, sleep deprivation, noise aversion), and daily activities while under observation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the psychiatric observation log, detailing his physical condition, psychological state, complaints, and daily activities while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: Mentioned as the officer who will be moving the detainee to a different cell in response to his complaint about a malfunctioning toilet.

connections.description: The Lt. is a correctional officer responsible for the detainee's custody and is taking action to move him to a different cell.

events.title: Interview regarding SHU incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is interviewed and states he cannot remember what happened in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) that caused marks on his neck. He reports severe sleep deprivation prior to the incident.

events.title: Psych observation and cell complaint
events.description: Epstein complains of a malfunctioning toilet that flushed continuously for 45 minutes, causing him significant distress and agitation. He is scheduled to be moved to a different cell by the Lt.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) - inferred primary location
Special Housing Unit (SHU) - location of prior incident
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein reported having unexplained marks on his neck from an incident in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) which he claimed he could not remember.
Epstein reported severe sleep deprivation, stating he had only slept about 30 minutes per night for five days prior to the SHU incident due to noise.
Epstein expressed significant anxiety about returning to the SHU and described an aversive reaction to a malfunctioning toilet noise, which he compared to his experience in the SHU.
The document notes Epstein was spending about 12 hours per day in attorney conferences, impacting the accuracy of his meal tracking on the observation chart.
Epstein suggested he 'may have something on the Autism spectrum,' comparing himself to a character in the movie 'Rain Man' and stating he is 'really good with numbers.'
